Name: Terasys API
Description:
Below are all the endpoints available in the API. Make sure to read all the descriptions to get a better idea of how the endpoints function.

Only requests sent over HTTPS are valid.

Endpoints.Name: Register Admin
Endpoints.Description:
This endpoint is used to register administrators in the system. To use the endpoint an administrative key must be supplied as an additional body parameter.

Default admin registration key is: **8JadZIptT2ysZPKQUAdBWw.lwewT8M4**

TestCases.Name: Register Admin
TestCases.Description:
This endpoint is used to register administrators in the system. To use the endpoint an administrative key must be supplied as an additional body parameter.

Default admin registration key is: **8JadZIptT2ysZPKQUAdBWw.lwewT8M4**

Endpoints.Name: Register User
Endpoints.Description:
Use this endpoint to register a new user. Devices can be assigned to user on creation, but are not required.

**Must be logged in as admin to use this endpoint**
**Requires JWT token in header**

TestCases.Name: Register User
TestCases.Description:
Use this endpoint to register a new user. Devices can be assigned to user on creation, but are not required.

**Must be logged in as admin to use this endpoint**
**Requires JWT token in header**

Endpoints.Name: Register Device
Endpoints.Description:
Before being able to send data to the API, each device must be registered using this endpoint. Simply include the device mac address in the request path, and it will return a key to be included with all subsequent data POSTs.

**Must be logged in as admin to use this endpoint**
**Requires JWT token in header**

TestCases.Name: Register Device
TestCases.Description:
Before being able to send data to the API, each device must be registered using this endpoint. Simply include the device mac address in the request path, and it will return a key to be included with all subsequent data POSTs.

**Must be logged in as admin to use this endpoint**
**Requires JWT token in header**

Endpoints.Name: User Login
Endpoints.Description: This endpoint is used to log in to the API. If login is successful, this endpoint returns an authorization token to be included as a header for endpoints that require JWT authorization.

TestCases.Name: User Login
TestCases.Description: This endpoint is used to log in to the API. If login is successful, this endpoint returns an authorization token to be included as a header for endpoints that require JWT authorization.

Endpoints.Name: Forgot Password
Endpoints.Description: This endpoint can be used to initiate the password change process. POST the user's email address. The API will send an email to the user to link to the password reset page.

TestCases.Name: Forgot Password
TestCases.Description: This endpoint can be used to initiate the password change process. POST the user's email address. The API will send an email to the user to link to the password reset page.

Endpoints.Name: Reset Password
Endpoints.Description: Use the GET version of this enpoint to check the validity of a password reset token.

TestCases.Name: Reset Password
TestCases.Description: Use the GET version of this enpoint to check the validity of a password reset token.

Endpoints.Name: Reset Password
Endpoints.Description: Use this endpoint to issue the password reset to the API. The API checks to see if the token is valid for that user, and updates the password in the database.

TestCases.Name: Reset Password1
TestCases.Description: Use this endpoint to issue the password reset to the API. The API checks to see if the token is valid for that user, and updates the password in the database.

Endpoints.Name: Logout
Endpoints.Description:
This endpoint is used to log user out of system and revoke JWT token.

**Requires JWT token in header**

TestCases.Name: Logout
TestCases.Description:
This endpoint is used to log user out of system and revoke JWT token.

**Requires JWT token in header**

Endpoints.Name: Get user details
Endpoints.Description:
Use this endpoint to retrieve user profile data. When authenticated as user, the user profile is returned. When authenticated as admin, the user ID supplied in the path is used to retrieve user profile.

**Requires JWT token in header**

TestCases.Name: Get user details
TestCases.Description:
Use this endpoint to retrieve user profile data. When authenticated as user, the user profile is returned. When authenticated as admin, the user ID supplied in the path is used to retrieve user profile.

**Requires JWT token in header**

Endpoints.Name: Update User Details
Endpoints.Description:
This endpoint is used to update user details. When authenticated as user, the corresponding user profile is updated. When authenticated as admin, the profile corresponding to the user ID supplied in the path is updated. Admins can directly change password.

**Requires JWT token in header**

TestCases.Name: Update User Details
TestCases.Description:
This endpoint is used to update user details. When authenticated as user, the corresponding user profile is updated. When authenticated as admin, the profile corresponding to the user ID supplied in the path is updated. Admins can directly change password.

**Requires JWT token in header**

Endpoints.Name: Get Device(s)
Endpoints.Description:
This endpoint is used to retrieve details for one or all devices associated to a user account. To get all devices associated with user profile, omit the mac address.

**Requires JWT token in header**

TestCases.Name: Get Device(s)
TestCases.Description:
This endpoint is used to retrieve details for one or all devices associated to a user account. To get all devices associated with user profile, omit the mac address.

**Requires JWT token in header**

ExpectedHeaders.Name: Access-Control-Allow-Headers
ExpectedHeaders.Value: Authorization, Access-Control-Allow-Headers, Origin, Accept, X-Requested-With, Content-Type, Access-Control-Request-Method, Access-Control-Request-Headers

Endpoints.Name: Add New Device
Endpoints.Description:
This endpoint is used to add a device to the system. Only accessible as admin.

**Requires administrator access**
**Requires JWT token in header**

Parameters.Name: Body

TestCases.Name: Add New Device
TestCases.Description:
This endpoint is used to add a device to the system. Only accessible as admin.

**Requires administrator access**
**Requires JWT token in header**

InputParameters.Name: Body

Endpoints.Name: Update Device
Endpoints.Description:
This endpoint is used to update device details.

**Requires administrator access**
**Requires JWT token in header**

Parameters.Name: Body

TestCases.Name: Update Device
TestCases.Description:
This endpoint is used to update device details.

**Requires administrator access**
**Requires JWT token in header**

InputParameters.Name: Body

Endpoints.Name: Remove Device
Endpoints.Description:
This endpoint is used to remove devices from the database. Also removes API keys.

**Requires administrator access**
**Requires JWT token in header**

TestCases.Name: Remove Device
TestCases.Description:
This endpoint is used to remove devices from the database. Also removes API keys.

**Requires administrator access**
**Requires JWT token in header**

Endpoints.Name: Generate Device Key
Endpoints.Description:
Use this endpoint to generate a key for a new device. If device is already in system, it returns the existing key. Users can only generate/retrieve keys for devices that are associated with their profile.

**Requires JWT token in header**

TestCases.Name: Generate Device Key
TestCases.Description:
Use this endpoint to generate a key for a new device. If device is already in system, it returns the existing key. Users can only generate/retrieve keys for devices that are associated with their profile.

**Requires JWT token in header**

Endpoints.Name: Get Device Key
Endpoints.Description:
Use this endpoint to retrieve the key for the device specified in the path. Users can only access keys for devices associated with their profiles.

**Requires JWT token in header**

TestCases.Name: Get Device Key
TestCases.Description:
Use this endpoint to retrieve the key for the device specified in the path. Users can only access keys for devices associated with their profiles.

**Requires JWT token in header**

Endpoints.Name: Regenerate Device Key
Endpoints.Description:
Use this endpoint to change the device key. Users can only change keys for devices associated with their profiles.

**Requires JWT token in header**

TestCases.Name: Regenerate Device Key
TestCases.Description:
Use this endpoint to change the device key. Users can only change keys for devices associated with their profiles.

**Requires JWT token in header**

Endpoints.Name: Post Data
Endpoints.Description:
This endpoint is used to receive data from the devices. The different metrics are provided in an array inside the body of the POST request.
Refer to sample for format.

**Requires device key in POST body**

Endpoints.Name: Get Data
Endpoints.Description:
Use this endpoint to retrieve datapoints for the metric and device specified in the path. Users can only access data for devices associated to their profile.

**Query Parameters:** page: for pagination results: for number of results per page, defaults to 10 filter: select field to sort by, defaults to timestamp order: asc or desc
**Requires JWT token in header**

TestCases.Name: Get Data
TestCases.Description:
Use this endpoint to retrieve datapoints for the metric and device specified in the path. Users can only access data for devices associated to their profile.

**Query Parameters:** page: for pagination results: for number of results per page, defaults to 10 filter: select field to sort by, defaults to timestamp order: asc or desc
**Requires JWT token in header**

Endpoints.Name: Create View
Endpoints.Description:
Use this endpoint to retrieve different views for a user. Views are uniquely identified by their name. Users can only retrieve views associated to their profile. If logged in as admin, the views belonging to the user specified in the path will be returned.

**Requires JWT token in header**

TestCases.Name: Create View
TestCases.Description:
Use this endpoint to retrieve different views for a user. Views are uniquely identified by their name. Users can only retrieve views associated to their profile. If logged in as admin, the views belonging to the user specified in the path will be returned.

**Requires JWT token in header**

Endpoints.Name: Get Views
Endpoints.Description:
Use this endpoint to retrieve different views for a user. Views are uniquely identified by their name. Users can only retrieve views associated to their profile. If logged in as admin, the views belonging to the user specified in the path will be returned.

**Requires JWT token in header**

TestCases.Name: Get Views
TestCases.Description:
Use this endpoint to retrieve different views for a user. Views are uniquely identified by their name. Users can only retrieve views associated to their profile. If logged in as admin, the views belonging to the user specified in the path will be returned.

**Requires JWT token in header**

Endpoints.Name: Update View
Endpoints.Description:
Use this endpoint to update/change the details for a view. Users can only modify views associated with their profile. Admins can change views for a specific user by providing a userid field in the request body.

**Requires JWT token in header**

TestCases.Name: Update View
TestCases.Description:
Use this endpoint to update/change the details for a view. Users can only modify views associated with their profile. Admins can change views for a specific user by providing a userid field in the request body.

**Requires JWT token in header**

Endpoints.Name: Delete View
Endpoints.Description:
Use this endpoint to remove a specific view. Users can only remove views associated with their profile. Admins can remove views for a specific user by providing a userid field in the request body.

**Requires JWT token in header**

TestCases.Name: Delete View
TestCases.Description:
Use this endpoint to remove a specific view. Users can only remove views associated with their profile. Admins can remove views for a specific user by providing a userid field in the request body.

**Requires JWT token in header**
